comments.author: Lucy @ Lucy eats
comments.content: Wow it's like a pizza AND a pie! Ingenious! It looks delicious -am looking forward to trying this (maybe with the salami though..)

comments.author: Stephanie
comments.content: That double crust looks amazing. Drool.

comments.author: michele
comments.content: I make a version of this, but with an unyeasted dough.  It makes it easier to roll out paper-thin, but I expect your dough would be much richer in flavor.  I always keep a bowl of no-knead pizza/flatbread dough in the fridge, so I think I will experiment with your recipe to see if I can roll it out thin enough to be a sfincione and not just a calzone (not that there's anything wrong with that!).  If only I could remember to save my potato-boiling water to make potato bread...

comments.author: Kristi Rimkus
comments.content: That's the best thing about pizzas, you can fill them with most anything you like. This time of year is perfect for veggies pizzas now that the farmers markets are opening again here in Seattle.
